p: Some viruses do not influence the encapsulation of viral proteins into vesicles, but control the packaging of host factors (see Figure 1d). This occurs in the case of Kaposiâ€™s sarcoma-associated herpesvirus (KSHV/HHV-8). EVs released by KSHV-infected cells are enriched in metabolic proteins, such as lactate dehydrogenase, and in proteins affecting the immune system such as the cleaved forms of IL-1 and IFI16 [ 81, 82]. Consequently, KSHV-EVs alter the metabolism and the innate immune response in recipient cells, facilitating viral persistence.
